title: Maintenance - Bank Angle Indicators

body.body: Bank Angle Indicator (D Series, not DS, DC3, DEX)
Inspect the bank angle indicators on the rider's footrests for wear. The bank angle indicators are worn out when 5 mm of the bank angle peg remains.
Bank angle indicators must be replaced when they have reached the maximum wear limit of

Use of a motorcycle with bank angle indicators worn beyond the maximum limit (when the bank angle indicator is worn to a minimum 5 mm in length) will allow the motorcycle to be banked to an unsafe angle. Therefore, always replace the bank angle indicator pegs when they are worn to
Banking to an unsafe angle may cause instability, loss of motorcycle control and an accident.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DU3; DT3; DP3; DUX (do not use - delete if found in use); DF2; DF; DE2; DE; DUY; DC; DZA; DZ; DA2; DBX; DB2; DB; DU; DP2; DPA; DP

body.body: The bank angle pegs must not be used as a guide to how far the motorcycle may be safely banked. This depends on many various conditions including, but not limited to, road surface, tyre condition and weather. Banking to an unsafe angle will lead to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
